Description: Part of a jar-seal: of pale brown clay, bearing an impressed inscription which shows the name of Peribsen and the figure of the god Ash. This seal is in good condition, although the surface of the clay is slightly worn.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pl.XXIX, 88; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XXII, 179; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl.77, abb.286; see also vols. I, 155 and II, 844, n.920; 1131.
